basics.name: Emma Rafkin
basics.label: Data Scientist/Software Engineer
basics.summary: An NLP researcher interested in low research languages, domain adaptation, information extraction, and knowledge modeling.

work.name: Johns Hopkins University Applied Physics Laboratory
work.summary: Researcher and engineer focused on NLP and knowledge representation. In this role I've proposed and led research and development efforts leading small teams (2-6 people) as well as communicated research findings to sponsors and internal stakeholders. Research areas include: responsible AI, LLM domain adaptation, information retrieval, relevance ranking, information extraction, topic summarization, adversarial AI, entity disambiguation, and multimodal anomaly detection.

work.name: Dartmouth Applied Learning and Innovation Laboratory
work.summary: Developed full stack websites for start ups and researchers. I have experience with building frontends with modern frameworks such as React and React Native as well as backends with Node.js/Express.js. From September 2020 to June 2021 I was the Women in Science Program lead for DALI and was on the core executive board.

work.name: Speech Surrogates Website
work.summary: Created a full-stack website and database for Professor Laura McPherson displaying her work on musical surrogate languages.

work.name: Alarm.com
work.summary: Created scheduled reports to inform property managers about low battery devices throughout the units they manage. Enhanced an existing report that informed property managers of alarms and issues throughout the units the managed.

work.name: Cambly Inc.
work.summary: Worked on the Android app in Java and Kotlin. Implemented the adult courses pages. Streamlined the chat UI across the app.

work.name: Dartmouth College Computer Science Department
work.summary: Mentored students in the Object Oriented Programming course. Held weekly recitation sections to help enforce the concepts learned in lectures. Graded all assignments, labs, and tests. Held office hours to collaborate with students to help them develop a deeper understanding of the nuances of the topics.

work.name: Camp Nicolet for Girls
work.summary: Responsible for a cabin of 8 13-year-old girls for the 8-week season. Planned, supervised, and executed daily activities, meals, and special events. Selected to lead a week-long advanced water ski skills camp. Lead week long canoeing and hiking trips in the back country. Certified in CPR, life guarding, and ski instruction.

work.name: Thayer School of Engineering
work.summary: Answered computing questions for the students and faculty at Thayer. Worked with clients to solve hardware difficulties. Implemented an organizational system across the computing services at the school.

awards.title: 8x peer awards for techincal excellence and leadership
awards.awarder: Johns Hopkins University Applied Physics Laboratory

awards.title: 7 IP disclosures for original work
